page.title: 02ST.HELEN'S CHURCH,GROVE.
page.content: The present church,dedicated to St.Helen,was opened by the Bishop of Lincoln on 8th December,1882.Records show that it was cold and snowing,but the church was full with 120 people. The Bishop and congregation had gathered in the older church and then proceded to the new church,slightly to the north.The former was then demolished,having stood for 400 years. The new building cost Â£5,000 and was a gift from Mr.Harcourt Vernon. The present organ is two manuel and was installed in 1894.The white alter frontal was embroidered by the Sisters Of St.Marys',Wantage.The parish register dates back to 1726 and is in a good state of preservation.The church contains beautifully carved woodwork behind the alter,threestained glass windows and the tomb of Humphrey Havey,1511-from the former church.
